website_summaries.verdict: A top-of-the-line bike computer from a top brand with all the features you could want.
pros: This bundle comes with all the accessories you need to collect as much data as possible from your bike rides
It includes a GPS computer as well as a USB cable, heart rate strap, speed and cadence sensors, and mount
The waterproof touchscreen works with gloves

customer_reviews.title: Won't work with Garmin cadence sensor, Garmin support won't help.
customer_reviews.text: I "upgraded" from the Edge 1000 and the cadence is too high and erratic. I paired my Garmin 935 running watch and the cadence meter is working fine, just on with the Edge. I contacted Garmin support and they told me to take the cadence sensor of the bike. As a professional cycling and triathlon coach, I've owned dozens of Garmin products. Their support used to be exceptional, but in the last several years they seem to be OK with their products just not working. I'm just one customer and they essentially have a monopoly. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth E Mierke

customer_reviews.title: 1030 is better than 1000.
customer_reviews.text: I had a 1000 but the switch failed after almost 4 years and 15,000 miles of use so I upgraded to 1030 The 1030 screen is larger and easier to read. The 1030 screen is not activated by sweat which was a problem with the 1000. I can go 100 miles 8 hours without the battery dying unlike my 1000.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Pricey and inferior
customer_reviews.text: Huge screen, easy to read. However, Livetrack which is NOT new tech, has never worked on this model. But it did and still does work on older models. It would be merely baffling if it was not such a critical safety function(solo riders) on Garmin's most expensive device. Added to that, my own device will no longer charge and is only 6 months old. I live in Houston, TX, so cold temps didn't kill the battery. Avoid this product, it's a ripoff.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Data Data Data.  There's no substite
customer_reviews.text: Smart phones are getting smarter but they aren't equal to the 1030..yet If you really want to improve your cycling game you need information. This computer will give it ALL to you. Great for night rides too, which is important for me because I hate riding in the sun and there is less traffic...which mean less chance for some idiot on their phone to run you over. The 1st thing I learned with this computer is how much aerodynamics effects your speed...ride on the lowers and eek out another mile per hour. NICE.
customer_reviews.author: Blood King

customer_reviews.title: If you really really need it, it works.
customer_reviews.text: The new Garmin 1030 keeps having so many software updates I can't count anymore. Paring is more complicated than with previous models. As advertised battery life. Some of it warnings are helpful especially if in unfamiliar parts. Heart rate only starts when in motion, so difficult to know it is paired correctly. Unless your are tech savy, have extra cash, or just need the latest then the 820 might be better value. I tried to change batteries in a 1000 and 2 pins broke so that's why my course of action.
customer_reviews.author: les

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed with the Garmin Edge 1030
customer_reviews.text: I have used a Garmin 800 cycling computer for several years; it has functioned flawlessly. I found the newer and larger Edge 1030 on sale and jumped on the opportunity to upgrade. Working in the computer industry and specifically on interface design and user satisfaction with the technology, was very frustrated with the Garmin 1030. After several hours trying to pair the Garmin 1030 with an iPhone, I failed and gave up. My thoughts are, if Garmin can't Bluetooth pairing correct, what are the other pain points and how much time will be wasted trying to make the Gramin 1030 function as well as my years old Garmin 800?
customer_reviews.author: ivan sandy wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Product syncing with phone and computer does not work
customer_reviews.text: Biggest mistake purchasing this product as I have other Garmin products like the Forerunner. The EDGE does not connect to the phone using bluetooth on an IOS device after trying numerous ways found on YouTube. WIFI shows it is connected but has no action. PC updates with Garmin Express hangs up after hours of waiting. For an expensive purchase cost, spend your money on another GPS unit like a Polar who have better software engineers.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Lemus

customer_reviews.title: Bike  Nav Computer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this computer as a replacement . The screen is bigger than what I had. The computer works fine with another brand HRM. I initially used a speed and cadence sensor but removed it because I want my speed to measured by the GPS. I bought a Garmin Cadence Senosor. Pairing was easy. I am still getting my data field screen setup what I want to see on the ride. I like the trail warning that pops up about steep upcoming corner. 4th day using it . So far so good. I did buy a cheap silicone cover to mask the computer name while riding and curious eyes.
customer_reviews.author: glenties

customer_reviews.title: Will not connect
customer_reviews.text: Read all of the reviews that say this unit will not connect by usb -- and believe them. If you buy this unit, you will spend hours of highly frustrating time trying to connect. It simply refuses to do so.
customer_reviews.author: PHW

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I waited a long time to buy a Garmin bike computer. My Edge 1030 is fantastic, I will never ride without it. It has opened up a whole new world of cycling to explore with map navigation, and I am taking full advantage of its capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice, had the 820 before this one. This one I can see without my glases :-)
customer_reviews.author: DST Chemicals Inc

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read and generally works pretty well; however the HRM and the power functions are erratic
customer_reviews.author: pierre

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what the problem is?
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what all these "tech guys" are having issues with connecting their iPhones via bluetooth to this Garmin? I'm an idiot, and it connected in about 35 seconds out of the box. I upgraded from a 520 solely for the ridiculously awesome navigation maps, I haven't even ridden my bike yet and i'm excited to be able to see road names (even on B roads) while fartin' around. It's a lot of money, yes, but if you like to get lost and have no sense of direction, just buy this first.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Derks

customer_reviews.title: Love it despite the defective one I received
customer_reviews.text: Love my Garmin! Top of the line. I purchased two (my boyfriend also cycles). For some reason after two weeks of using it. my Garmin shut down and took 24 hours to power on. Thinking it was just defective. I called Amazon aka Amazing and they immediately issued a new device which took three days for me to receive. This one is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha B

customer_reviews.title: Great Cycling Computer
customer_reviews.text: Great when paired with the radar taillight. The map feature is great when riding in an area you are not familiar with. Can download maps from Strava(must have paid subscription to use live segments) can upload rides automatically. Pairs with Ant+ and Bluetooth sensors. The only con I have is price. They do go on sale occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Rod Fuchs

customer_reviews.title: Good bike computer
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I'm spoiled but these bike computers feel like a 386 computers in the i7 cpu age. The screen is more responsive with each firmware update it seems but nothing fluid like a mobile device at that price point. It has simpler functions than a mobile device, and it's doing a fairly decent job. So 4 stars max.
customer_reviews.author: STeeL

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid GPS cycle computer
customer_reviews.text: I have my Edge 1030 paired to a Samsung Galaxy phone and it works great and I have been using it for months. I have it mounted on my handlebars with an upright angle to make reading it easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love It.
customer_reviews.text: Big screen - easy to read - I need it. Tons of features. Data. Data. Data. The more the better! Huge improvement over the Edge 1000 (which I have used for 4 years).
customer_reviews.author: Cycling Enthusiastic

customer_reviews.title: Another great cycling product by Garmin
customer_reviews.text: I have had the following Edge models --205, 305, 705, 800, and now the 1030. The first 3 were not the greatest models. But improved design and battery technology have made the 800 and 1030 fantastic. I would still be using the 800 (have owned it for 7 years) but my spouse broke the mount on her unit. I really enjoy the larger screen and improved maps over the 800. Wifi syncing is nice too. I am not sure the battery lasts as long as they say I haven't used it enough to determine that for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Tidd

customer_reviews.title: Love it Customer Service is great
customer_reviews.text: Had a GARMIN 305 jump to a 1030 love it really helped me with my riding with all the technical information on it and also third-party apps the more I play with it the more I love it
customer_reviews.author: Randy Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Great edge IF you want all the features
customer_reviews.text: Overly complicated features. Not intuitive. Requires simultaneous use of the connect app for group tracking feature. However the battery life is great and i really like the larger and brighter screen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Edge1030 whit problems !!!
customer_reviews.text: the device is working very badly. it goes off by itself, it does not catch on easily it takes time, for me it has a technical failure or for something at the time it cost me less, but it is incredible that they sell one a bad or troubled team
customer_reviews.author: german gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity is just awful
customer_reviews.text: Connectivity to iPhone is awful. It keeps dropping Bluetooth connection, so phone call and text notifications rarely come in. Also occasionally drops sensor connections and requires a device rest to reconnect.; big pain while riding! I should have stuck with the 1000. Tech support NOT helpful in resolving these issues.
customer_reviews.author: aviterra

customer_reviews.title: Garmin does it again...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome... I have the 820 which is great as well.. I have it paired with the varia light... if you do alot of riding alone, I would highly recommend investing in this with the varia...
customer_reviews.author: javier santiago

customer_reviews.title: The GPS feature is excellent and lasts a long time
customer_reviews.text: The GPS feature is excellent and lasts a long time. I used to carry a regular gps on long rides but need to any more. This is loaded with software that may take me at least a year to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Four Seasons

customer_reviews.title: connection is imposible either via bluetooth or usb and the issue instead of getting better it gets worse with every firm upgrade
customer_reviews.text: By all means AVOID buying this Garmin, connection is imposible either via bluetooth or usb and the issue instead of getting better it gets worse with every firm upgrade. Do not throw your money away.
customer_reviews.author: Bernardo Norena

customer_reviews.title: Good bike computer
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy was spotty the one navigation ride I did. Additionally, searching for locations and addresses isn't user friendly. I don't know if it is because I had to download maps from a 3rd party. For a device that cost ~$700 local/regional maps should be included.
customer_reviews.author: Waymon J. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Initially received device 1030 with a defective Cadence sensor. Emailed vender and got an immediate response to correct the sensor. Very good customer service. Thanks for making an unfortunate situation very tolerable.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Leon Feuerbach

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift for my mom. She loves it and can now see in real time her progress and can push her limits. -Ex-triathlete
customer_reviews.author: Thorpetsgh

customer_reviews.title: Great little unit.
customer_reviews.text: Compact, light, long battery life, easy to read maps...everything we need for touring and recreational rides. Intuitive interface. Garmin nailed it on this one.
customer_reviews.author: stokerqueen

customer_reviews.title: Only for iPhone
customer_reviews.text: The description did not include this. I requested another only to see that designation on the box,on the corner of the side.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas H. Barnhart

customer_reviews.title: love the battery life
customer_reviews.text: 20hrs of use time.. can ride 100 miles and not have to worry about battery going out
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gottlieb

customer_reviews.title: Garbage do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage! Do not buy this! Shuts off during your ride, will not connect to Garmin cadence sensor or iPhone. When it does, you can guarantee it will soon disconnect! Can not update firmware! Plus, it’sThe size of a cell phone!!!! Sending this garbage back ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: Upstate New York

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: After less than two years the display screen has separated from the device. Also, there is a glitch with the battery in that it may be fully charged but the battery indicator will show a low charge. This apparently is a known issue that has yet to be resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Best Garmin device
customer_reviews.text: I just don't know why it took me so long to buy it! Garmin has been great for me for many years and this has now topped of my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Has great turn by turn direction function
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from my Garmin edge 1000. Better battery life and a few more functions. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Benoit909

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Thought I was getting the best but this has turned into the worst. 2 months HR monitor quits. Main unit not accurate, bad trail info, and tons of issues syncing. Wish I could return but out big time....
customer_reviews.author: Paul Struck

customer_reviews.title: Exited to use 1030, but also disappointed with cadence sensor
customer_reviews.text: I use it for cycling. View of figure and letter size awesome. Unfortunately something wrong with cadence sensor, it do not work, not even connecting with edge 1030, big disappointment. All other accessories conected ( speed, gears)
customer_reviews.author: Izak Schreuder

customer_reviews.title: Over priced unless you want the socialization
customer_reviews.text: Excellent screen; easy to read. Touch screen is handy. Too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Every thing is good quality and I am happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Mark L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Awesome upgrade to the 520. I got it for the physio true up capabilities with my fenix 5 watch, which works well. Very large, but I'm getting used to it.
customer_reviews.author: matandmic

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but expensive
customer_reviews.text: Negotiation with no problems. I'm feeling the 1030 harder to deal than Edge 1000. Data screens complicated to edit. With Edge 1000 data fields were added or removed easily...
customer_reviews.author: mdzagg

customer_reviews.title: Will Not Hold up to a Snow Blower
customer_reviews.text: Tough and durable GPS. I have dropped it on mtb trails multiple times, lost it for a couple of days in a state park after driving away with it on my trunk, and generally crashed a lot with it on my bike. It survived all of this even before I put on the rubber protector and it worked every time. Even the incident detection was unaffected by my overall abuse of it. Sadly, it did survive going through my snow blower after falling out of my car and into the snow without my realizing it. 10/10 will get another.
customer_reviews.author: GhettoJesus

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I returned the product for a refund. I believe it was defective. It would not navigate to a downloaded course, regardless of the method importing a course. Garmin connect/express, ridewithgps, txc, fit, gpx..nothing worked. The course might load, but it would not calculate distance to destination etc., and it would not give turn directions, though the course appeared on the map and my position was accurate. Two calls/chats to Garmin, and they wanted to blame it on 3rd party (ridewithgps) file corruption. Followed their instructions to delete folders etc. Used a file created on Garmin Connect, reset the device. Nothing worked. This problem is evident on their forums, but they are unresponsive. I'll wait for an updated version.
customer_reviews.author: MER

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable connectivity
customer_reviews.text: One of the main reasons I went with this model was for wireless uploads. Phone connectivity is horrible. 9 times out of 10 I end up connecting via usb cable on my computer to upload. Constantly power cycling, re-pairing and deleting/reinstalling the Garmin Connect app on my phone in an attempt to restore connection. As I'm typing this I have spent the last 30 minutes trying to get the device to connect with my phone.Already went through this yesterday after yesterdays ride, having to do it again after todays ride.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: A great unit
customer_reviews.text: This is a great unit. I like the large screen. There is so much to this unit that I will probably never be able to offer a full review. I am still learning how to use some of its features . the ones I use seem to work well. It seems to connect with the sensors with out problem. some times it is difficult to get it to connect with my Galaxy note 9 but after a few attempts it does connect.
customer_reviews.author: Mike XYZXYZ

customer_reviews.title: Garmin Edge just keeps getting better.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this unit. It’s my third Garmin Edge (705 & 810). Seems familiar but has many additional features that I find useful..Screen size was important so that my 70 year old eyes could read the display more easily. Set up and integration were quite simple. Quick delivery and pleased with the vendor, too. Highly recommended purchase.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Parker

customer_reviews.title: works some of the time, when it works, it works well.
customer_reviews.text: I'd like for this to work all the time, but it doesn't. It functions the way it was designed about 50% of the time. It doesn't sink consistently and the software isn't very user friendly. I wouldn't buy another one and I wouldn't recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Works well, worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to wait a few months and a couple thousand miles of rides before posting this review. This replaced an Edge 800 that I had for about 8 years before it decided to retire. I was pleased with the 800, but the 1030 puts it to shame. Much easier to read at speed, more information per page, and good battery life. The interaction with the Garmin app works well and improves the whole experience. Price of course is a concern and the 1030 certainly isn’t cheap. Now that I have one I can say it was worth the money to me and I would do it again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great device, lots of data
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the 520 edge. I really love this device. I have had no connectivity issues and it imideately found my cadence, speed and heart rate sensor. Battery life is great and visibility is great due to the size of the screen I can take a quick glance at everything while scanning the road. Not sure about 700 bucks but definitely an asset to my rides.
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS WILLIAMS

customer_reviews.title: Sad
customer_reviews.text: I.m tired :( since yesterday been trying connect Bluetooth, download and sync Strava, download maps and still no progress, will return and try the 830
customer_reviews.author: Luciana F Marques

customer_reviews.title: It lives up to its rating.
customer_reviews.text: It is for my husband and he loves it. The rear radar tail light is a much and he feels every cyclist should have one. He got the 510 that works with the Garman. I like it because I can follow him on my computer or apple phone. This was if he has any problems I will know where he is.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Todd

customer_reviews.title: Great computer!
customer_reviews.text: Much better screen then my former Edge 820! Touch response is better too, but still could use some tweaking. Software in the 1030 adds several UI upgrades like reorganizing data fields, setting up Wifi, and connecting to a phone.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike computer with lots of info and functions.
customer_reviews.text: More information than you'd ever want to know. Easy to set up and use. Works great, well worth the fun.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Great for lots of info
customer_reviews.text: This is great for lots of info at a single glance. It also has tons of data and functions I'm still getting use to.
customer_reviews.author: michael s

customer_reviews.title: Worked until it didn’t!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this bike computer until it quit working and I had to return it!
customer_reviews.author: Mark12

customer_reviews.title: Other than that it was great.
customer_reviews.text: It would not pair with my phone.... probably just a sick device in this case. Other than that it was great.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS cycling computer.
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate gps with long battery life. The larger display is easy to read and operate.
customer_reviews.author: Glen A. Just

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS, Software needs some work
customer_reviews.text: As far as GPS functionality it works great, it was easy to pair my HR monitor, speed and cadence sensors, and my new cycliq fly12 and fly 6 lights but some of the time it does drop the connection from them but not every time. I’m sure garmin will fix in a future release.
customer_reviews.author: Cycleman

customer_reviews.title: feels like it was thought up and just thrown together by ...
customer_reviews.text: Epic Fail! This device is not ready for prime time, and might not ever be. I have had this for over 2 months, and after roughly 800 miles of riding with it I am just about ready to chuck it. Cons: Loses connections to sensors constantly! have to constantly try and reconnect to no avail. Loses connection to phone constantly! Interface/widgets are kludgy, feels like it was thought up and just thrown together by a bunch of monkeys. Pros: Great battery life, though doesn't even come close to what is advertised. I'd wait for the second iteration of this device.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Murray

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike computer
customer_reviews.text: I'm a recreational cyclist and a data nerd. I love my Garmin 1030. So many features.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: Used it 10 times already. Very accurate and lots of data to analyze how you’re progressing
customer_reviews.author: Lars

customer_reviews.title: Great and very easy to read screen
customer_reviews.text: I do believe this is one of the best cycling computer in the market today, the screen size & quality is great has all the features plus more for professional cyclists maybe but the segmentation with Strava is great ... it’s great
customer_reviews.author: Thani

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Garmin, better than edge 1000 way worth the money
customer_reviews.author: John Rupcich

product_meta.title: Garmin Edge 1030 Bundle, 3.5" GPS Cycling/Bike Computer with Navigation and Connected features, Includes Additional Sensors/Heart Rate Monitor
product_meta.description: Style:Performer Bundle| Pattern Name:ComputerRide longer and stay connected with the edge 1030 GPS cycling computer. It features Trend line popularity routing, which uses billions of miles of rider data to show you the best on- and off-road routes. It also includes a preloaded Garmin cycle map and new navigation alerts that notify you of Sharp curves ahead. Push your performance limits with the newly updated preloaded Strava live segments. Or use the preloaded training peaks app to complete workouts from your coach. Rider-to-rider messaging and group track help you stay aware and communicate with your buddies as you go. Edge 1030 is compatible with Varia rearview radar and smart bike lights, and it has built-in incident detection to help create a safer riding environment.
